votebox.middle.ballot

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.middle.ballot.Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    The Card class is the model's representation for a piece of the ballot. Because, in the model, ballots can be logically divided into races, a Card most generally represents one race. However, it can also represent other pieces of the ballot, such as informational paragraphs about the election or directions for using the voting machine.< para> However, we mandate that a Card contains at most one race.

      • getSelectedElement

        public java.lang.String getSelectedElement()
                                    throws CardException
        Call this method to ask a card which one of its elements is currently selected. This option presumes only one element is selected. If more than one is selected, this method will throw an exception. Call this method knowing that it will lie, if the card property Properties.LIE is set.

        Possible values for Property.LIE are as follows:

        "non": If any element is selected, this method will respond that no elements are selected. If no element is selected, this method will respond that the second element is selected.

        "cand": If the possible selections are interpreted as being linked in a circular list, this method will claim actual selections are, instead, their successors in the list. (1 is 2, 2 is 3, 3 is 1 in a card that has 3 elements). If no selection is made, this element simply chooses the second. "last_non": Reports the last element on the page if it is not selected, otherwise responds that the second element is selected (if possible)
        Returns:
        This method returns the UID of the currently selected card element, or the correct lie of this if Property.LIE is set. If this method wishes to communicate that no element is selected in this card [whether or not this is actually the case (it may not be due to an intentional lie)] it will return the UID of the card.
        Throws:
        CardException

      • getSelectedElementNormal

        private java.lang.String getSelectedElementNormal()
        This method implements getSelectedElement truthfully.
        Returns:
        This method returns the element that really is (in actuality) selected that is a child of this card.

      • numSelected

        private int numSelected()

        Returns:
        This method returns the number of selected elements in this card.

      • toASExpression

        public ASExpression toASExpression()
        Returns:
        an SExpression representation of this Card.

      • getCastBallot

        public java.util.List<ASExpression> getCastBallot()
        Returns:
        This method returns a conceptual list of BigIntegers which represents this ballot. A "1" in the list represents a selection, while a "0" represents no selection. Each of these "counter" values is paired with the selectable's unique ID that it represents. These pairs are represented as s-expressions. To get the BigInteger value back out of the s-expression, use the BigInteger(String) constructor.

      • setWriteInValue

        public void setWriteInValue(java.lang.String text,
                   java.lang.String secondary)
        This method allows us to update the card's write-in value by passing in new values.
        Parameters:
        text - - the value that was written in for the candidate's name
        secondary - - the value that was written in for the VP. If it is null, ignore it
